content:
Renewable energy technologies have made significant advancements in recent years, and they are now capable of generating large amounts of clean energy. While it's true that renewable energy sources such as solar and wind don't generate power 24/7, energy storage technology has also advanced and can be used to store excess energy generated during peak generating times for use later during times of low generation. 

Furthermore, renewable energy technologies work together to complement each other. For example, wind turbines may generate more energy at night, while solar panels generate more energy during the day. Hydroelectric power may also be used to balance fluctuations in solar and wind energy production.

The key to ensuring that renewable energy is able to meet all our energy needs is to continue investing in research and development of these technologies. By developing more efficient and cost-effective energy technologies such as energy storage and smart grids which can better distribute the generated energy according to the demand, we can increase the capacity of renewable energy to meet energy demands. Additionally, we can encourage cooperation among electric utilities in distributing renewable energy so that energy can be shared across regions and hence, increasing the robustness of the renewable energy system as a whole.
